intro: Wurdastom ecuadorensis, commonly known as the Ecuadorian wurdastom, is a unique flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth surface, while its stems are slender and often covered in fine hairs. Wurdastom ecuadorensis is adapted to grow in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and moderate rainfall.
